page.title: 08Traffic and Motorway
page.content: Three{major roads}bisect King's Worthy and it's two associated villages. The traffic on the King's Worthy Link Bridge the{A34}can easily be seen between Headbourne Worthy and King's Worthy. The{A33 or Winchester By-pass separates Abbots Worthy and King's Worthy and during the summer months and at weekends has always caused major congestions and traffic flow problems. It is an accident blackspot with many serious accidents. On May 22nd 1985 the newest stretch of the{M3 Motorway}opened between Popham and Easton Lane, Winchester. Already the local residents of King's Worthy have noticed the improvment.The triple intersection is virtually free of fast moving and heavy, noisy traffic. The newest eleven mile stretch has cost Â£25 million.
